results:
Based on the search results, I can provide you with comprehensive information about Polish theater productions of "Romeo and Julia" (Romeo i Julia) and their connections to Polish Romanticism, particularly the works of Mickiewicz and Słowacki.

The search results reveal several important Polish theater productions and institutions involved in staging Romeo i Julia:

## Teatr Narodowy Productions

The Teatr Narodowy (National Theater) in Warsaw staged Romeo i Julia on their Opera Stage, with the premiere on May 18, 1996. This was Sergei Prokofiev's ballet in 3 acts and 13 scenes. The production featured choreography by Emil Wesołowski, music by Sergei Prokofiev, conducted by Tadeusz Wojciechowski, with set design by Andrzej Kreutz Majewski.

The Teatr Narodowy also staged a dramatic version of Romeo i Julia with a premiere on May 16, 1981, directed by Ryszard Peryt.

## Teatr Słowackiego (Słowacki Theater)

Multiple productions of Romeo i Julia have been staged at theaters named after Juliusz Słowacki, the great Polish Romantic poet:

- The Bałtycki Teatr Dramatyczny im. Juliusza Słowackiego (Baltic Drama Theater named after Juliusz Słowacki) in Koszalin staged productions with premieres on February 24, 1962, and November 16, 1980
- Another production at the Bałtycki Teatr Dramatyczny im. Juliusza Słowackiego in Koszalin premiered on September 12, 1998, directed by Stanisław Nosowicz
- The Teatr im. Juliusza Słowackiego (Juliusz Słowacki Theater) in Krakow continues to stage Romeo i Julia

## Mickiewicz Theater Connections

The Teatr im. Adama Mickiewicza (Adam Mickiewicz Theater) in Częstochowa staged Romeo i Julia with a premiere on November 20, 1958, directed by Barbara Kilkowska.

## Connection to Polish Romanticism

The naming of these theaters after Adam Mickiewicz and Juliusz Słowacki, the two giants of Polish Romanticism, is significant. Both poets were central figures in the Polish Romantic movement of the 19th century. Shakespeare's Romeo and Julia, as a drama about "tragic love of two young people who became models of romantic lovers," resonates strongly with Polish Romantic sensibilities.

## Contemporary Productions

Recent productions include:
- A musical version at Teatr Muzyczny Capitol directed by Jan Klata, described as "an adaptation of one of William Shakespeare's most famous dramas, telling the story of the love of two young people from rival families"
- Teatr Wielki Opera Narodowa continues to stage concert versions of Gounod's opera Romeo i Julia

The Polish theater tradition has embraced Shakespeare's Romeo i Julia as a work that speaks to universal themes of love, conflict, and tragedy that resonated particularly strongly with Polish Romantic ideals and continues to find new interpretations in contemporary Polish theater.
